Class UUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • unlekker.util.UUtil
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    processing.core.PConstants, UConstants

    public class UUtil
extends java.lang.Object
implements UConstants
    Set of static utility functions.

    Marius Watz

      • expandArray

        public static java.lang.Object expandArray(java.lang.Object[] list)
        Expands an array of Objects to double of its current size. Remember to use cast to turn the result into an array of the appropriate class, i.e: someArray=(SomeClass [])unlekker.util.Util.expandArray(someArray);
        Parameters:
        list - Array to be expanded.
        Returns:
        Array of Object [], must be cast to appropriate class.

      • SIN

        public static final float SIN(float deg)
        Sine function based on lookup tables. About 4 times as fast as Math.sin, but be careful not to give a value of more than 360 degrees or less than zero. If in doubt use @see #SINSafer, it rounds the value off before use.
        Parameters:
        deg - Angle in degrees
        Returns:
        Sine of angle

      • COS

        public static final float COS(float deg)
        Cosine function based on lookup tables. About 4 times as fast as Math.cos, but be careful not to give a value of more than 360 degrees or less than zero. If in doubt use @see #COSSafer, it rounds the value off before use.
        Parameters:
        deg - Angle in degrees
        Returns:
        Cosine of angle

      • SINSafer

        public static final float SINSafer(float deg)
        Fast sine function based on lookup tables. Unlike SIN(), SUBSafer() checks the bounds of the degree before use.
        Parameters:
        deg - Angle in degrees
        Returns:
        Sine of angle

      • COSSafer

        public static final float COSSafer(float deg)
        Fast cosine function based on lookup tables. Unlike COS(), COSSafer() checks the bounds of the degree before use.
        Parameters:
        deg - Angle in degrees
        Returns:
        Cosine of angle

      • chopBraces

        public static java.lang.String chopBraces(java.lang.String s)
        Removes '[' and ']' from beginning and end of a String, but only if both are present.
        Parameters:
        s -
        Returns:

      • stripBraces

        public static java.lang.String stripBraces(java.lang.String s)
        Will remove all occurrences of the characters '<', '>', '[', ']', '{' and '}' from the input string and return the result. Beware: While chopBraces() only removes those characters from the beginning and end of a string, stripBraces() will remove characters from all positions in the string.
        Parameters:
        s -
        Returns:

      • wrapTextArray

        public static java.lang.String[] wrapTextArray(java.lang.String s,
                               int len)
        Takes a long String and breaks it down into an array of separate Strings of maximum "len" length. Useful for preparing text for display on screen.
        Parameters:
        s - String to be wrapped
        len - Maximum character length of each line
        Returns:
        Array of String objects containing the wrapped text.
